metadata.synopsis: |Standing quietly behind the Big Barn, Rowan is just trying to do his job and maybe avoid getting too involved with the refugees and locals that are making a fuss on the other side of the building.  He’s not the most courageous, and certainly not hard-working, but his job isn’t exactly fascinating right now. |
metadata.how_to_trigger: 1) Open debugbook2) Got to Region3) Act 34) Wyrm's Crossing5) Refugee Camp6.0) oe OIStartOrinFlamingFist to start the dialog (do the other steps below first if you want them enabled)6.1) oe OIEnableOrinFlamingFist to enable journal as Orin6.2) oe OIMetOrinOnce to enable that you've met Orin in previous impersonation.

49.text: Hail, friend. Fine day, isn't it?

34.text: Forgive me - you're in no mood to talk about the weather. Your journey here was a hard one, no doubt.

44.text: Is this your first time in Baldur's Gate?

4.speaker: Player
4.text: It is. I can't believe I'm finally here.

3.text: Well, whatever you've heard - the reality might not be quite so rosy.
3.context: NodeContext: with a sigh, this fact pains him

38.text: Used to be you'd arrive knowing you'd a full belly and a warm bed waiting for you. Not any more.

60.text: These days, there's barely enough to go around. Add the refugees on top and... well, folk aren't feeling too generous.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: I'm not surprised. Tensions seem high around here.

99.text: Some well-to-do's in the city donated enough to see the newcomers right for the time being. Only they didn't bother helping everyone else.

103.text: Locals going without while strangers feast - it's stoked the fire, all right. Some Baldurians are kicking up a fuss round the front of the barn as we speak.

35.text: If I wasn't wearing this uniform, I'd walk round there and teach them a lesson they'd never forget.

93.speaker: Player
93.text: The people of this city have grown selfish. They need reminding what true hardship is.

32.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
32.text: We can be the reminder. Soft citizens make easy targets.

21.text: Too bloody right. They've gone soft behind those walls, forgotten what it's like to struggle, living hand-to-mouth.
21.context: NodeContext: releasing a pent up anger

5.speaker: Player
5.text: If the refugees have more than they need, it's only fair they give some back.

53.text: Too bloody right. But will they share? Not a chance.

11.text: Those refugees have been leeching on our city for too long. If we don't show them we mean business, they'll bleed us dry.
11.context: NodeContext: releasing a pent up anger

91.speaker: Player
91.text: I'm all in favour of re-education. It sounds like they have a lot to learn.

8.text: I knew you'd feel the same way.

13.text: We need to march round the front, and kill every last one of them. Let's see them eat our food with their guts on the floor. What do you say?

41.speaker: Player
41.text: They're innocent people. You can't just kill them!

15.text: Why does it matter? Innocence makes the blood run clearer.

68.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Flaming Fist  transforms into Orin. Long transform.

101.text: Look at it, come crawling home, hands stained with the Bone Lord's soot. And you carry his stone.
101.context: NodeContext: 'It' is the Dark Urge player. 'Home' at this point is just the city, not yet the temple. 'Bone Lord's soot' refers to the player having killed Ketheric (his god Myrkul is the Lord of Bones)

48.text: Yours is a crude and clumsy violence, sibling. You'll hack a jagged path through this city to reach me.
48.context: NodeContext: Player previously agreed to massacre innocent people. Judging - thinks you're a brute, but curious to see the carnage you leave in your wake

81.text: I could end it now - but I'll be patient. Father will see us together again. He will see you bleed.
81.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappears.NodeContext: Toying with the player, trying to make them uneasy, establish her power over them. 'Father' is Bhaal.

78.text: Have you lost your nerve, my blood-starved sibling?  Did I mangle your skull too terribly?
78.context: NodeContext: Player previously refused to kill civilians. Mocking - finds this pathetic. 'Mangle your skull' refers to her putting the tadpole in your brain

37.text: So you're the lickspittle who crushed the Bone Lord's thrall.
37.context: NodeContext: First time Orin meets player. 'Bone Lord's thrall' is Ketheric, who player previously killed. Curious.

52.text: Have you come beg-begging, sniffing for our stones? Gortash won't like that. A throat his black hand can't choke the spit from.
52.context: NodeContext: Mocking, finds your plan ridiculous but enjoys the chaos it will cause. 'Stones' are the netherstones. 'Black hand' reference to the 'Black Hand of Bane', Gortash's god.

67.text: He will tremble at your slaughter. So eager to spill the guts from this city.
67.context: NodeContext: 'He' is Gortash. Player agreed to massacre innocent people. Orin excited to see the chaos you leave in your wake

39.text: You'll need to bleed and carve this city if you want to turn him to grave meat. He shivers at the thought.

77.text: When you find the lordling, tell him Orin is watching.
77.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappears.NodeContext: Playful, menacing. Trying to make player uneasy - she could be hiding anywhere.

54.text: I see how you slip-slither closer, belly dragging in the filth. Father is laughing at you.
54.context: NodeContext: Second time Orin appeared to toy with you. She can't believe you're wasting so much time.

84.text: Do not worry, slaughter kin. My blades are still sharp and sweet. They will greet you soon enough.
84.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappears.NodeContext: Mocking reassurance - trying to make the player uneasy.

17.text: Still rolling in the muck, I see.

12.text: Gortash knows you are coming. Knows you have the Bone Lord's stone. Do not let him hiss hot air into your worm-weakened brain.
12.context: NodeContext: Acting like she's helping you, but just trying to freak you out. 'Bone Lord's stone' is Ketheric's netherstone

57.text: Remember - his throat spits lies, but my blade carves the truth. You will read it on your skin soon enough.
57.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappears.NodeContext: toying with the player, knows the 'truth' about them and is enjoying holding this against them

16.speaker: Player
16.text: You're speaking my language. I'm in.

22.text: What a wonderful language it is. Bleeding. Slicing. Snapping. Goring. They taste divine on my tongue.

88.speaker: Player
88.text: Both sides need teaching a lesson: let's kill them all.

69.text: Yes, yes, yes! Slit and slice and chop and bleed them. Not a soul left alive!

18.speaker: Player
18.text: You're a monster. I'm reporting you to your commanding officer.

26.text: Tell them! I'll cut out their eyes and make them watch.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: I kill discreetly and with purpose. Openly murdering refugees seems rather clumsy.

50.text: You think there's a better way? Such sickening naivety, but I will cure you of it.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: A quick solution to an annoying problem. Count me in.

98.speaker: Player
98.text: I kill discreetly and with purpose. Openly slaughtering civilians is hardly my chosen approach.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: I won't be party to your wanton fantasy.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: You might be surprised. I've known people to bite - fight back.

76.text: I hope they do. The more they fight, the quicker the blood will spill.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: I will do better than mindless slaughter: it is not the answer.

65.text: Mindless slaughter is the only answer.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: Let's soak the earth with entrails, kill and kill again!

80.speaker: Player
80.text: Hardly the most satisfying opponents. I'll save my energy for a real fight.

29.text: People here have gone soft living behind the city walls, forgotten what it's like live one day from destruction.
29.context: NodeContext: releasing a pent up anger

85.text: I say we march round there and slit a few bellies. Remind them how much worse things could be. What do you say?

96.speaker: Player
96.text: You're supposed to keep the peace, not stoke the fire.

63.text: What peace? If no one steps in, there'll be bodies piled high in the streets before long.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: I'd think your uniform would be enough to make them quieten down.

66.text: The Flaming Fist isn't what it used to be. It's grown weak, corruptible, soft.

104.text: It's down to honest citizens like me to stand up for what's right, uniform or no. That lot round front - they've got it coming to them.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: I didn't come looking for handouts. I take care of myself.

89.text: That might be the simplest approach. Unfortunately, not everyone sees things that way.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: I've got ways of making people share.

46.text: The way things are going, it might well come to that.

40.speaker: Player
40.text: Is there anything I can do to ease these people's burden?

79.text: I've been asking myself the same question. I wouldn't be the first to interfere.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: Sounds like that's your problem, not mine.

47.text: If it were my problem, I'd do something about it. Instead they've stuck me guarding this door while they squabble over the donations.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: I've passed through, but I'm a Waterdeep man at heart.

100.text: A word of advice then - you might not get as warm a welcome as in days gone by.
100.context: NodeContext: with a sigh, this fact pains him

9.speaker: Player
9.text: Yes. I'm almost entirely sure I'm a Baldurian.

51.text: It's a fine city, isn't it? No better place to hail from.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: My home is somewhere. I must live here.

6.text: You do? My apologies. It's usually newcomers who seek my aid, though with the way the city's been recently, they've been staying away in droves.

105.speaker: Player
105.text: I think... I think I have been here. Although I don't remember it much.

43.text: Is that so? Enigmatic soul, aren't you?

23.speaker: Player
23.text: Not my first, but hopefully my last. It's not the most salubrious of destinations.

7.text: Ah. Maybe our city's finer qualities can win you over yet, though I'll admit, they're in short supply at the moment.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: Yes, I heard the streets were paved with gold... the coin purses, too.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: Sure. Never been before - anyone tells you differently, they're lying.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: Plenty of times. Got the scars to prove it.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: It's best to not ask where I conduct my... business. For your own safety.

94.speaker: Player
94.text: My past is none of your concern.

42.text: No offence intended, just being friendly. You won't find many make others making the effort.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: Do they pay you extra to act so godsdamned cheerful?

33.text: Of course not. But most folk appreciate a kind word these days.
